title: internal compiler error matching std::env in static variable initializer.
body:
`rustc` panics while compiling and matching an environment variable in static variable initializer.

I tried this code:

```
use std::env;

static A_STATIC_VARIABLE: bool = match env::var("HOME") {
    Ok(val) => {
        if val.starts_with("/User/") {
            false
        } else {
            true
        }
    },
    Err(e) => true
};

fn main() {
}
```

It returns a note saying the compiler unexpectedly panicked.

```
examples/compiler_crash.rs:4:8: 4:11 error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_typeck/check/dropck.rs:288: no enclosing scope found for scope: CodeExtent(5/Misc(26))
examples/compiler_crash.rs:4     Ok(val) => {
                                    ^~~
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```
## Meta

rustc --version --verbose:

```
rustc 1.11.0
binary: rustc
commit-hash: unknown
commit-date: unknown
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.11.0
```

Backtrace:

